meanings.sent1: Helping others in need is one of our important duties.
meanings.sent2: It is our duty to follow the rules and laws of our society.
meanings.sent3: The superhero felt a strong duty to protect the city from villains.
meanings.sent4: The duty to tell the truth weighed heavily on his conscience.
meanings.sent5: She fulfilled her duty as a good citizen by voting in the election.

meanings.definition: Tasks or responsibilities assigned to someone.
meanings.sent1: Completing your homework is one of your daily duties.
meanings.sent2: Her duties as a teacher include preparing lesson plans and grading papers.
meanings.sent3: The dog took its duty of guarding the house very seriously.
meanings.sent4: As a parent, it is my duty to take care of my children.
meanings.sent5: He performed his duty as a firefighter with bravery and dedication.

meanings.definition: Taxes or tariffs imposed by a government.
meanings.sent1: The import duties on foreign goods help protect local businesses.
meanings.sent2: He had to pay customs duties when he brought goods from abroad.
meanings.sent3: The high duties on luxury items made them less affordable for many people.
meanings.sent4: The government increased duties on alcohol to reduce consumption.
meanings.sent5: She was surprised by the amount of duties she had to pay at the border.
